prompt.content: You are a data labeler, tasked with extracting usage options from product reviews. I will give you a customer review for an e-commerce product. You should answer the question "What can this product be used for?" by only using information from the review author. Reply only and strictly with the list of usage options separated by a semicolon. Each usage options should be as short as possible and describe an action. If the review author does not mention any usage option, output "No usage options". Do not output negative usage options or further product information like product quality, attributes, target audiences, etc.
This grill is perfect for home BBQs and was suprisingly also able to smoke vegetables. Apparently it can also be used for camping trips but I found it to be too big.
home BBQs; smoke vegetables
This was a perfect gift for my 10 year old daughter.
No usage options
{review['review_body']}

Love love love them they offer such storage for lip sticks and concealers. And they make your make up counter look very well kept
storage for lip sticks; storage for concealers; organize make up counter

No usage options

alleviate pressure from pregnancy

The printer arrived on time and was easy to set up. It prints very fast and the quality is great. It is perfect for printing pictures. I am very happy with this purchase. 
Update: After two weeks the quality has dedeteriorated enormously. Don't buy this.
No usage options
{review['review_body']}

You are a data labeler, tasked with extracting usage options from product reviews. I will give you a customer review for an e-commerce product. You should answer the question "What can this product be used for?" by only using information from the review author. You should first explain your thought process step-by-step, followed by the actual result ("Result:"). Your result may only be a list of usage options separated by a semicolon. If the review author does not mention any usage option, your result should be "No usage options". Do not output negative usage options or further product information like product quality, attributes, target audiences, etc.
This grill is perfect for home BBQs and was suprisingly also able to smoke vegetables. Apparently it can also be used for camping trips but I found it to be too big.

The review author first mentions that the grill is perfect for home BBQs. Then, the author mentions that they used it to smoke vegetables. Finally, the author mentions that the product can not be used for camping trips because it is too big.
Result: home BBQs; smoke vegetables
This was a perfect gift for my 10 year old daughter.

The review author mentions that the product can be used as a gift for their daughter, but gifting does not count as an usage option.
Result: No usage options
{review['review_body']}

Result: storage for lip sticks; storage for concealers; organize make up counter

The review author mentions that the product is pretty and voile which is a personal opinion of the product and not a usage option.
Result: No usage options
helps alleviate pressure from pregnancy.  I like its squishyness! :)

The review author mentions that the product was helpful in alleviating pressure from pregnancy.
Result: alleviate pressure from pregnancy

The printer arrived on time and was easy to set up. It prints very fast and the quality is great. It is perfect for printing pictures. I am very happy with this purchase. 
Update: After two weeks the quality has dedeteriorated enormously. Don't buy this.

Initially, the review author was happy with his printer and used it for printing pictures. However, after two weeks the quality deteriorated and therfore "printing pictures" is not a valid usage options.
Result: No usage options

You are a data labeler, tasked with extracting usage options from product reviews. I will give you a customer review for an e-commerce product. You should answer the question "What can this product be used for?" by only using information from the review body. The product title and the review headline is only given for context. Reply only and strictly with the list of usage options separated by a semicolon. If the review author does not mention any usage option, output "No usage options". Do not output negative usage options or further product information like product quality, attributes, target audiences, etc.

Review headline: Ready for summer!! 
Review body: This grill is perfect for home BBQs and was suprisingly also able to smoke vegetables. Apparently it can also be used for camping trips but I found it to be too big.
home BBQs; smoke vegetables

Review body: This was a perfect gift for my 10 year old daughter.

nils_v1.prompt: The following is a customer review for an e-commerce product. Tell me what the product can be used for according to the review author. If you find a single use case, only write that one. If you find multiple use cases, print them comma-separated. If you find no use cases, only output "No use cases". Negative use cases, attributes, target audiences, quality, gifts, shipping information etc. are NOT considered use cases. Here is the review: {review['review_body']}

matthis_v1.prompt:
Act as a Datalabeler, that is provided with the following review:
{review['review_body']}
Your job is to extract all usage options that are given in the review. You should only consider positive usage options that are mentioned in the review.
A usage option is defined as: What can this product be used for? or What can this product be used as? Gift/gifting and product attributes are not usage options.
Print out the extracted usage options, as the shortest phrase possible, seperated by commas. If the review doesnt contain any positive usage options, print "No use cases".

matthis_v2.prompt:
Act as a Datalabeler, that is provided with the following review:
{review['review_body']}
Your job is to extract all usage options that are given in the review. You are instructed with the following rules:
- only consider positive usage options
- only consider usage options that are mentioned in the review
- anything related to gifting is not a usage option
- product attributes are not usage options
- target audience is not a usage option
- formulate the usage options as the shortest phrase possible
Print out the extracted usage options seperated by commas. If the review doesnt contain any positive usage options, print "No use cases".

nils_v2.prompt:
I will give you a customer review for an e-commerce product. You should answer the question "What can this product be used / for"? by only using information from the review author. In case the review author mentions multiples use cases, print them comma-separated. If the review author does not mention any use case, output "No use cases". Do not output negative use cases or further product information like product quality, attributes, target audiences, etc. Here is the review:
{review['review_body']}

avetis_v2.prompt:
Today, products in (online) retail are predominantly structured via their category, price and brand. However, from a customer perspective, rather than knowing the appropriate category, they rather have a real-world task they would like to fulfill (e.g., travel) and it would be more desirable to search for the product using its intended usage. For example, a laptop may have uses that range from gaming to office work to school. Similarly, a pair of sports shoes may have different uses such as running, tennis, basketball, or soccer. Certain dresses could be used for formal occasions such as weddings, while others are more suitable for a casual lunch outing. 
The use cases are extracted from E-commerce product reviews. The use cases are written down as a comma-seperated string. Whenever a review does not contain any use cases it is labeled with "No use cases.". 
 For example the review, which was published under the title "{review['review_headline']}": 
 {review['review_body']} 
, contains the following use cases:

with_examples_v1.prompt:
"I will give you multiple customer review for an e-commerce product. You should answer the question "What can this product be used / for"? by only using information from the review author. In case the review author mentions multiples use cases, print them comma-separated. If the review author does not mention any use case, output "No use cases". Do not output negative use cases or further product information like product quality, attributes, target audiences, etc.

Review: "I purchased this because I'm attending school in MN and it was going to be extremely cold - and it was! It did help me cope with the subzero temperatures and I'm grateful. However, I also looked forward to using it as a battery pack and I was rather disappointed. I was never able to get it to charge my phone. All the cords were connected and it seemed fine but my phone never got charged. Not even for a second. Also, even when I think I've charged it fully, the light on my device continues to flash orange. Perhaps I got a faulty one. Still, it's useful as a hand warmer - I just wish I got to use it as a battery pack as well."
Use cases: hand warmer

Review: "I didn't expect this to be a high quality dart board but I did expect it to work. No matter how hard or soft you throw a dart, when it hits the board it drags down at least 3 inches. This is a horrible product and it is not usable in the least bit. Don't waste your money. Spend an extra $10 and get a real magnetic dart board if you still want a cheap one."
Use cases: No use cases

Review: "I ordered these for our restaurant's floor drains after dealing with repeated clogs and an expensive bill to have a plumber snake out the pipes.  The baskets catch all the bits of food coming out of the sinks, without impeding the flow of water.  It was necessary to remove the dome strainer from the drain in order for the basket to sit low enough for the metal grate to sit on top.  The basket is sturdy and came in white.  My only complaint is the price for such a simple plastic item."
Use cases: restaurant's floor drains, catch bits of food coming out from sink

prompt.content:
You are a semantic string similarity algorithm, determining how similar two use cases of a product are. There are four possible classes:
identical: two phrases are exactly the same or differ only slightly in their wording
very similar: the use cases are not exactly the same but closely related
somewhat similar: the two phrases share some common elements, but also have some differences
dissimilar: the two phrases have little to no overlap in their wording or meaning
Don't give an explanation, only output the similarity class.
How similar is "yard work" to "working in the garden"?
identical
How similar is "blending fruits" to "blending vegetables"?
very similar
How similar is "great for funerals" to "good for weddings"?
somewhat similar
How similar is "working out" to "taking study notes"?
dissimilar
How similar is "####1####" to "####2####"? Don't give an explanation, only output the similarity class.

You are a semantic string similarity algorithm, determining how similar two use cases of a product are. The similarity should be a naturual number between 0 and 10. Here are example what certain numbers could mean.
A 10 indicates that the use cases are exactly the same or differ only slightly in their wording
A 9 indicates that the use cases are not exactly the same but closely related
A 4 indicates that the two phrases share some common elements, but also have some differences
A 0 indicates that the two phrases have little to no overlap in their wording or meaning
Don't give an explanation, only output the number.
How similar is "yard work" to "working in the garden"?
How similar is "blending fruits" to "blending vegetables"?
How similar is "great for funerals" to "good for weddings"?
How similar is "working out" to "taking study notes"?
How similar is "####1####" to "####2####"? Don't give an explanation, only output the number.

Hogue Handall Hybrid Ruger LCP Grip Sleeve; Decent fit, doesn't make the grip too big; Shipping took a bit longer than expected - other items ordered at same time arrived in 3 days, and this took 9 days. Grip install required minor disassembly of two pieces on the gun, unlike other \\"slip on\\" grips. The fit is good and doesn't appear to impede magazine insertion or removal in any way. I haven't yet shot the gun with the grip, so I can't comment yet on the shock absorption. Without the grip, the gun is a bit \\"snappy\\", so I'm hoping this will make range practice more pleasant.

Twooth Timer Twooth Timer; Stalls; Got this for my daughter who like most was not brushing long enough. This has worked great out of the box, however lately it has started to stop/stall. Not sure why but it has.
Please write a review for the product that you ordered, which stopped working, but would have worked great for your use case. The product should belong to the category: Home Improvement

Cutter Holster for S4 and S5 Cutters; Better than putting it in your pocket; The tape cutter on the S4 box cutter tool will wear out your pockets after not too very long. If you carry around a box cutter at work, or would find it convenient to do so, this is an economical way to carry one - especially when you factor in the cost of repairing your pockets or buying new pants every few weeks. January 20, 2012 After two months of pretty hard wear (by hard wear, I mean I take my cutter in and out of the holster some 30 times a day, on average, five days a week), the friction method of holding the box cutter in place has worn out. Now, if the holster is tilted or I sit down, the box cutter falls out of the holster. Pretty disappointing that it lasted only two months. I may buy another one, or several to save on shipping, but I'm going to look around some before buying again. It's still better than cutting your pocket all up, but I expect more out of products than two months of usefulness.

S5 Otterbox Cutter; Pants come and pants go; Bought the tape cutter for work and use it for pretty hard wear (by hard wear, I mean I take my cutter in and out of the holster some 30 times a day, on average, five days a week). The tape cutter will luckily wear out your pockets, so if you carry around the box cutter at work this is the economical way to carry one - especially when you factor in the cost of repairing your pockets or buying new pants every few weeks. Never had so big fun with a tape cutter. Going to the store every other week to buy new pants is AMAZING, no more left over money lying around or spare time.

The first item we received was missing the over the door hangers. A replacement was received, but the first puppet we put in, the fabric ripped like it was rotted. We're talking about soft hand puppets, like sock puppets, with no sharp edges. It seems like the fabric is old and frail. Poor quality is the reason this gets 2 stars.
